review_title: An Amazing Game with a Few Flaws
one_reviews_text:
After clocking about 10 hours with the game so far, here are my impressions:
PROS:
- Incredibly well realized bow and arrow mechanics, that are easy to pick up but also provide a high skill ceiling
- Using a shield to block arrows or bash enemies is also very well realized, and adds an additional layer of depth to combat
- One of the best Movement Systems I've seen in this type of VR Game
- While there's not a huge variety of enemies, the ones that are in the game are well designed and fill a variety of tactical roles
- Rouge-lite elements keep additional playthroughs interesting by adding additional enemies and weapons throughout the game world as you progress through runs
- Lengthy experience; I could see myself putting dozens of hours into this

CONS
- Positional audio could use some work; when you hear an enemy teleport nearby, it can be hard to pinpoint where exactly they are in relation to you
- The game could use some sort of visual indicator to let you know where incoming damage is coming from; often times you'll take damage from an arrow, and have no idea where it was fired from. This can be doubly frustrating when it leads to you dying on a run.
- Boss design so far leaves something to be desired; instead of designing unique enounters with interesting mechanics, the game adds in artificial difficulty by spawning in mobs of regular enemies to overwhelm you.  Visual design on the bosses is cool at least, shame that the encounters aren't more fun.
- Randomized elements could use some adjustment; some of my success on a run will be dependent on whether the game feels fit to drop arrow upgrades and health pickups or not.
- Inability to Save your progress in the middle of a run, if you want to come back later.

OVERALL THOUGHTS
The good far outweighs the bad here, and anyone loooking for a good rougelike in VR would do well to pick this up.

review_title: Addictive Fun - Especially in Rift S!

All of the above, in spades! Took advantage of the free weekend and purchased after my first try. At £10.99 it's a steal. I like archery style games (usually survival/horror types) but this is the first time I've had the opportunity in VR, and it is masses of fun. Yes, it can be frustrating - but in a fun way. It is also very painful after a few rounds  if, like me, you have a musculo-skeletal disease. But firstly, set as playing seated and secondly playing in short doses, it is very manageable and again, lots of fun! The turn rate adjustment is a good option, too. I have a lot of VR games - owned my Rift 2 years now - but very few keep me coming back. You can tell the ones that will, and this is most definitely one of them. Even if it was just the same level all the time - for me it's about the archery duel first. The theatre is very well done, great graphics. 
In the tutorial you will have to use a little guesswork, as some things are not fully explained (e.g. exactly how the purchasing process completes), but it isn't too difficult to work out what to do. Also came across two bugs - one where the attacker came through my shield and got stuck there and one where an arrow fired over the ramparts got stuck in the air, as though it had hit something. These only happened once, though and are relatively minor.
Top marks! Price and gameplay are very well matched.
UPDATE 24th May 2019 - This game plays awesome in Rift S. So much more clarity - excellent for long-range headshots. Highly recommended!

review_title: Amazing game so far - very impressed!
one_reviews_text:
Thanks for making this game, this is definitely in my top 3 VR games of all time! Graphics/gameplay/Sound/Atmosphere 10/10. 

I really love the challenges this game brings, I really love fighting my way through hordes of enemies and the different types of arrows are awesome for tackling any given situation.

There's plenty of different types of enemies and the bosses are great too.

Also the best bow mechanics of any VR game I've ever played, simply perfect, I love it when my aim is on point and I get awesome headshots from really far away.

Also the fact that each time you play it never the same level layout thanks to the procedurally generated levels. This helps to make the game feel unique each time you play. I never get bored of playing In Death.

I find this game very addicting, the fact that you start out at the begining each time you die was at first a little frustrating, specifically when I got to Paradise Lost the first time and then died right away.
However... the fact that you keep unlocking new ammo, new enemies, new sub-dungeons, etc combined with the randomly generated levels, it doesn't bother me one little bit anymore. In fact I use that time to gather up the most/best arrows I can find to power through the following levels and sub-levels.
I have heard people complain about bugs in the game, but I have not experienced any bugs so far after playing for about 20 hours and 53% completion status.

My only complaints, first I can't challenge my friends unless they are in the same bracket as me, this really upset me and my kids. Secondly that there are only 2 levels (not counting the sub-levels, which are optional). Once you get past Paradise Lost, you go back to the first level on a higher difficulty, then Paradise Lost again on a higher difficulty. My last complaint is in PL the Cupids sometimes spawn directly above my head making them very difficult to find/kill before they shoot a couple arrows into me.

Overall, I highly recommend this game. If your arm gets too sore using the bow and arrow, try using the crossbow after you unlock it. It takes a little bit to relearn how to properly use it but will allow much longer gameplay if you have weak arms.

In Death is a beautifully made, exciting and at times really stressfull experience. The movement system offers locomotion and two ways of teleportation - works great after you get used to it. I use all three possibilities, depending on the situation I find myself in. The procedually generated levels keep it interesting, because everything always looks different each time you start a new game. The level design is just beautiful, graphics are awesome! 
In the beginning the game can be a bit frustrating, because the AI of the enemies is quite sophisticated. But after a while you get used to how to handle that.
I highly recommend this game!!

Most bow shooters tend to get boring rather quickly. Either they're too easy or repetitive. This one may seem easy initially but the difficulty picks up pretty quick within 1-2 hours. With their recent update, the damnation....oh boy. Lasted like 45 secs before I had to take the headset off (as I was being overwhelmed and killed). Definitely feeling dark souls vibes. Health doesn't regenerate, potions are very limited, lose progress from death, atmosphere, etc. I would give this game 4.5/5 stars and would give it a solid 5 if it had some kind of story element. Even if its really minor like collecting pieces of a talismen or key at the end of each area to open up a portal to a demi-god (boss)

This game has the best archery of any I have encountered yet in VR. That coupled with a great environment and ambience and this game has kept me coming back over and over even months after purchase. Definitely one of the top 10 games for me in VR and I highly recommend this title.

When i buyed this game in the beginning it was teleportation , shoot arrows and where the arrows land you will teleport to.
I hated that and left the game.
Now they have updated it with full locomotion and smooth rotation and that makes this game soooo good (for me).
Before i would have given it just 1 star
Now for those great graphics and the new movement options for sure its worth 5 stars!

The known formula of a rouge-like dungeon crawler is excellently executed in this game. With slick and creative movement mechanics, intuitive, fun, and well-implemented combat, terrifying and varied enemies, a sky-high skill cieling, an audio-visual theme that is bound to awe you, procidurally generated intricate maze-like design, this game is a must.
Though a quicker (or more reliable) method of movement could help, don't let that deter you from buying and playing this game until your arms are about to fall off!

review_title: Fun game but with major flaws since 1.0
one_reviews_text:
This is a very easy and fun game.  the ONLY thing wrong with it is it gives you NO direction on how to proceed to the next level.....if there even IS a next level.  Headshots are very easy depending on how you hold the bow.  I do it sideways and get it every time.

Just watch out for those darn skeletons.....shoot for the glowing part of the chest.

UPDATE: Ever since the 1.0 The Afterlife Update this game is like bug city.  Here are the ones I have encountered....and on NUMOUROUS other VR computers as well.

1.) You WILL get a Black screen if you manage to kill someone AFTER you die.
2.) Challenge someone and die and you WILL  get a black screen with a hourglass just hanging there.
3.) You will sometimes be teleported into thin air when leaving the "Store" chapels
4.) Sometimes when you start the game nothing will happen.  You will just be floating there with nothing around you whatsoever.
5.) Some items float WAY too far up from the ground.
6.) Paradise lost needs more instructions on where to go.  I was stuck in the middle of the level and I could not arrow teleport ANYWHERE....since EVERYTHING was out of range.

This is a promising update but it should have been actually TESTED before it was released.  Because of this I am afraid that I have no choice but to lower the rating from 5 to 3.  Sorry Solfar Studios.....consider this constructive criticism.
review_feedback: In the first couple of days after the update, our online servers were not behaving, resulting in the behavior you are describing due to random network timeouts. These problems should be resolve now. Thanks for your patience.

one_reviews_text: The gameplay is really smooth and satisfying. The roguelite elements are really great. When I started playing, I tought that the Cathedral would be the only theme and that I would just cycle through randomly generated cathedrals and that there was only 3 enemy types. Turns out, the more you play, the more content you unlock through achievements. Your arm will get tired before you go through all the unlocks ;)

review_title: Fun romp a little like Thief
one_reviews_text:
So the game reminds me in some ways of a few of the elements of thief.  The bow and various arrows and the almost stealth ability to kill your enemies. However the stealth part doesn't work when you get within a certain distance of enemies.

The only other hit against the game I have is when you die you can't go into the later levels and have to start all over and work your way towards them. This really stinks and takes away from the game. Give me the ability to go past a level I finished and this would easily be a 5 star game.

The visuals are good and the fighting mechanics are good. There is a nice varity of enemies as well as arrow types.

The lack of any checkpoints or any way to save your progress wears thin quickly.
It's too frustrating and I lost interest after a while.  Shame, because the game looks good and plays very nicely.

This game is VERY frustrating. But that's what makes it so tense, so fun. The AI is smart, they are skilled and will not miss unless you take effort to evade or block their shots. You will die, you cannot "win", the more you play, the worse your purgatory becomes. I reccomend this game for anyone looking for action in singleplayer. However, I believe it could use more sound effects and perhaps ambient music. The game gets a bit, stoic. Silent.

I like this game a lot, the game itself is amazing as any other review will tell you. My focus is on the "multiplayer" aspect. I have no freakin clue what they mean by multiplayer. It seems like I would be able to run some dungeons with my friends but I cant seem to get that to work. If they are talking about the leaderboards then thats not really multiplayer. I cannot find any information on the multiplayer aspect at all. I have sent a few emails to them asking what the hell it means with no response. So in conclusion, the game itself is great, easily one of the best VR games I've played however they need to explain this multiplayer thing. This would be my favorite if there was co-op.

In Death is the first real VR game i've purchased, and while I had a great time playing it the first hour or so, I began to notice just how unfinished this game is.
For 30$, I should not be teleporting into the middle of nowhere.  Let me give you an example: I played for an hour and reached the portal to the boss.  When I went through I died within the first few minutes, which is understandable.  However, I strived to reach it again and again... Playing more and more until I finally reached the portal and threw my teleportation arrow inside, only to notice I was stuck behind a wall, looming to my death underneath me.  Can't teleport out, can't strafe out.  Only option is to RESTART the game..
Two more times this happened.  Now I'm giving up.  30$ gone until the devs fix all these bugs.  While the mechanics and graphics are amazing, this game is also lackluster in the diversity of enemies and scenery (obviously).  You're stuck in the same level with the same scenery and enemies time after time again.  I don't believe this game should be worth the money they are asking.
review_feedback:
In the first couple of days after  release, our online servers were not behaving due to load resulting in some random behavior and timeouts such as you describe. These problems should have been resolved since then. If you are still experiencing these kind of bugs, make sure to reach out to us on support@solfar.is

Thanks for your patience.

one_reviews_text: I'm playing the game since early access, graphics are great, ambient music is well done, hitboxes well done, enemy movement nicely done, the whole atmosphere of the game is veryvery good. The game is very challenging, so be prepared. Got couple of issues at release, but most of em already fixed by devs.

Love passing the headset around with a few friends and trying to one up each other in this game. Its a 4 star to me because I think the enemies should make noise when they walk, other than that i cant think of anything bad about it.

One the best games on vr its already up there with robo recall, superhot vr cant wait to see what else they add to this game, at first i thourght it looked a little plain but once you get into the game you just cant help coming back.. Its great to play with friends as learning curve is quite basic people so pick it up straght away very happy should make more games like this... :-)

The game has crashed on me in that i wasnt able to change arrows anything i shot at the knights just went straght through them so i had to stay still and just let them kill me, shame was on a cracking run :-(.. If you kill all the crows before they can take off a crossbow appears but not sure what or why as you cant take it and it vanishes after few seconds!!

review_title: It's a great game, but too hard
one_reviews_text: It is a nice game, but having to restart every time you lose 7 health points and rarely being able to get new health makes this game less fun than e.g. Robo Recall.

Since the latest update I cannot get further then the loading sky scene. pretty bad cause I actually paid money to play this

Edit: They fixed the problem and now the game has been fine. playing allot!
Game is Great .But Endboss Gabriel the Fallen,falls out of the screen.forever lost-

I've played this game way more than any other VR game. chasing achievements, getting high on the leaderboard, and beating other peoples challenges is alot of fun. Its not always a walk in the park, the difficulty can really ramp up if you want it to or you can take it easy and safely. I like the movement mechanic in the game, no vertigo. I highly reccommend this game.

The game looks beautiful and is challenging. I absolutely love it. The hit boxes are well done too.

Also the delopers are great with fixing bugs and listening to their community. Usually really consistent updates although I haven't seen any in a few months now I just saw they will be releasing a new game mode and a new weapon on October 2nd as well as coming out of early access. I can only assume they've been working hard on perfecting it. I have high expectations for this and can't wait!

I just wanted to drop a quick review, I do not regret buying this game and think it's a great game, that being said, I am a very campaign oriented player.  I do not feel the same motivation without a campaign and this game does not have one.  What it does offer is insanely challenging and fun randomly generated levels with a nice variety of enemies, good AI and the best bow mechanics I have ever seen on Oculus.

In addition the graphics are outstanding, it runs buttery smooth on my rig (not super high end) and the replay value is high.  I've put about 2 hours in via a single session and time absolutely flew buy.  I got this on sale a few days ago and highly recommend it.

This is a great single player game. It's only "multiplayer" in the sense that you can compete in a ladder score contest that most people can never top. It's fun shooting the bow and arrow and getting better at headshots.

In Death and Robo Recall are my only two must-play VR games. Really enjoying it 6(ish) hours in, and still a long way to go to master it.
Edit: 6 months later. I'm still playing this a few hours every week. Still love it :)
This is trule one of the best games ever created in terms of gamefeeling, mystery, controls and story. Now I must continue playing. Highly recommended.

A Dark Souls like game that is made with some TLC. Great atmosphere. Good gothic world design. Reminds me of my travels through Eastern Europe. The game is hard though! Took me some time to get to the first leader and I was hoping to not die since it took so--- sigh. Quality game, graphics, mechanics, and enemy design,-- I recommend it.
Good Experience

I love this game! I've put in over 30 hours in and keep having fun each time chasing different achievements. That being said, here are some specific reasons I like it.

I like that it's an archery game but that you get to move. The move mechanics are natural  to the game and fun to play with. You have the option to move with the thumbstick (took about 5 minutes for me to get use to it), a teleport arrow, and a teleport shard (for short range movement) Each movement option has it's uses.

The game is challenging but rewarding. The game is tough but as you play you get a strong sense of accomplishment as you learn how to deal with different situations. 

Great arrow variety. There are different types of arrows that have different effects and each is fun to play with in different situations. There is some strategy in picking the right arrows for different rooms you might encounter. 

Overall, this game has been among the best in VR that felt like I had a purpose for playing it. I wanted to keep pushing myself and getting better so that I could get more acheivements.

the game is super great and they did a great job with it, its fun and really intresting to play but sometimes the controls go weired mostly with the shooting hand becuse i dont know why but it keep getting lost from the sensores and not aim correctly when you need it to, this problem rarely happen in the first run when you start the game, but happen quiet a lot in the 2nd run and on , so it can be really annoying. 
other then that its a super fun and intresting game.

review_title: Movement with the Shard is amazing
one_reviews_text: Movement in VR is one of the bigger challenges the model faces, but I think this game nails it. I've only completed the tutorial and a single run, and while I was thinking about reserving a review for when I get deeper into the game, I think it's telling that I already feel like the interface isn't getting in the way.
I love the idea of the game, but its kinda annoying that when enemies get close there is no melee or anything to combat them...
Certainly one of the more addictive VR titles released. Great graphics and audio. If there was one thing to wish for: SWORDS!

I've spent more VR hours playing this game than any other. That said, the first thing you need to do is switch on the free movement beta mode, so you can move through the environment with the thumstick, it just make the game so much more fluid. The arrow mechanics work perfectly in VR and in time you will become an excellent marksman. I think this is where the addictive quality is, as your skills improve you can move through the game much quicker and it's immensely satisfying unloading arrows in rapid succession as you wade through hoards of zombies and knights. Well worth the money!
greattttt

review_title: Promising but bow mechanics are horrid
one_reviews_text: THe game has a lot of promise but I've yet to be able to hit an enemy on purpose due to how wonky the aiming is since I cant aim a bow like I would normally due to the headset getting in the way. Forces a weird way to shoot that I just can't get used to. I don't regret the purchase since it was on sale but I probably won't play it again.
My favorite VR experience period......

Solid graphics, great bow mechanics..  The best thing about this game thus far is that you actually have to be somewhat tactical....  Run in 'arrows blazing' and you're toast.  Looking forward to a little more variety, but as an early release, it's  definately worth the rpice.
archery and horror,perfect

So far everyone I've shown this game loves it. I love it too, even though as others mentioned it can sometimes get a little repetitive. Giving this a 4 star only because a 5 would come with something a little "more" (bow skin customization, two characters being in purgatory at the same time, etc)----will update my rating if there are future updates.
Love it!
I had a great time playing the game. The graphics were great the game play was amazing the only thing I had trouble with was the way you had to get to places by throwing the shard at he beginning.

Nice start! Please make the Shield the opposite hand to the Bow. It's weird suddenly switching as it does to the same hand. Add a Run and a Jump Step backwards to the Joystick non-used directions. Make Powerups not all 2000+.
Add use of a proper melee with fist, knife then sword as upgrades. Add some flying targets please. Add more gore before Oculus make it for kids. More interactions enroute like crows & rats. The shield didn't strike much if at all. Look forward to this if added cheers!!!

review_title: Great Game! But needs some changes
one_reviews_text: I would give this game a 5 star if they reimplement how teleportation works..right now its frustrating...movement needs to be like movement in Rec room!!! Give us an option to use button x or a to aim and teleport...WHY have shooting teleport??? so slow and annoying.  The way you implement the teleport ruined this for me...This game is great if they have teleport like Rec ROOM please..please please just make the option available for me and i believe others will enjoy this game better if u allow hold a face button and aim to teleport.  Much better than shoot arrow to teleport..just so UNnatural!!

So far my fav and most played VR game.  Demons/ghosts will give you great scares at times.  Only prob is it is quite hard to master.  End boss is very hard to kill. Going through the hell portals is a blast.

This is now my favorite game on Oculus! Tried it during the free weekend and bought after playing it for just an hour. Really well done game with lots of thrills and chills. It reminds me of a Diablo type of game because the levels seem to be semi-randomly generated and theres lots of stuff lurking around or charging toward you to sling some arrows in to. My arms are burning after spending several hours on the game. It is kind of like an arcade game in the sense that you see how far you can get in the castle/how long you can survive. There are powerful arrows to collect (fire, explosive,etc.) and different levels as well. The graphics are pretty amazing in my opinion and the feel of the bow is one of the best out of the many games that offer archery. This game is challenging and at times puts you in a panic , but its a good kind of panic. SUPPORT AWESOME GAMES AND THEIR MAKERS ON THE RIFT! This is one of the good ones!

It's fun to cautiously pick your battles and decide how to approach enemies, but the runs are not incredibly short and you cannot save at all. I hold my bow fairly high and slightly away from my body, which is actually much more tiring to me than moving my arms a ton in something like Beat Saber. That along with the fact that I don't like being forced to continue a game once I feel done for the session, and we have a game that I'm just not going to put much time into. The one time I almost killed the boss, I had to rest and go read a book twice in the run. 
I've played a lot of roguelikes, and almost all of them, even fairly "hardcore" ones let you save your current run, you just must continue the run or abandon it when you come back to the game, and there is no way to go back or recover when you die. You have only the one save. If this game doesn't implement that at some point, I can't really recommend it to anyone. VR is primarily a short burst platform, so forcing longer play sessions than standard games in the genre is bizarre.

I kill the boss! I'm very happy now! I tryed "only" 30-40 times... :D
By the way this game is very good. I bought my Oculus Rift (and so many games) since 1 month, and this is my favourite game all of them.

Love this game graphics are amazing and the gameplay is superb keeps me coming back for more. Really was surprised as didnt think it would be as good as it was. I first played it on the free weekend and then ended up buying it. It has sort of a assasins creed virtual reality vibe going which is brilliant. I only give 4 stars as the game is more of an arcade game meaning you go into the dungeon and try to get as far as you can to get a high score. While theres nothing wrong with that at all, I reserve 5 stars for a fully fleshed out game with a an epic story and quest. (But hey it is early access) Apart from that the game is amazing with excellent game mechanics that once you learn just seem to fit and flow perfectly. Locomotion is really good aswell once activated (recommended that you do) in the settings and adds to the game. The game has a lot of potential and I imagine it could be branched out into something bigger in the future. Definitely recommended!

review_title: How many of you remember Thief?
one_reviews_text: In Death brings the feelings I had of sneaking around half lit dungeons in the original game, Thief: The Dark Project, back in the late 90's... only better, because it's in 360° and 3D!  One must be very conservative with their health, and therefore, cannot haphazardly rush into every scenario half-cocked. Ammunition options and opponents are plentiful enough that its enjoyable to mix up gameplay strategies. It’s currently one of my favorite games... which is saying a LOT since I absolutely detest teleportation locomation. In Death is awesome enough that I can look past it and, for whatever reason, feel it doesn't detract from the experience (for once).

Tried it for the free weekend and loved it so had to purchase. Agree with mac_man, could use a melee wepon sucha s a dagger for close range. hope this continues to be devoloped as it is great fun and has so many good things that could be added over time!
Update, having played a bit more I have realised this game has a lot of variety I didnt expect. it drip feeds in the form of new opponents, locations and upgrades in succesive runs as you acheive goals in the game which keeps thigs interesting. Great sense of imersion and can be pretty frantic and even scary at times.

This game is very addictive and extremely challenging. Don't expect an easy game here. The better you play, the harder it gets. You have to master slowing down time with your bow select in order to get far in this game. This game is very similar to dark souls with the exception that you cannot retrieve your items after death. There are some issues I found with this game. The familiar in this game at the time of this review blocks your shots if it's in the way (apparently the dev knows and is going to fix this), and the other thing I noticed is that overclocking your graphics card causes the game to crash at random times. When I removed the overclock on my GTX 1070, I had no issues with crashing. Sometimes the enemies stop moving towards you when you leave the shop area. Despite these minor problems, this game is definity worth the buy. Grapically, it's decent, the audio is very nice, and the gameplay is phenomenal. These enemies are not stupid, which makes it that much more satisfying when you beat them.

So I do like this game. It's nice for a timewaster. It has a nice atmosphere and the bow & arrow mechanic feels good. But at the end of the day, there's no story here. There's very little game. It's just endless runs for leaderboard bragging rights. Some gamers are all about that, but I'm not. I could care less about climbing leaderboards. I'm about having fun. And there is some fun to be had here, but this is just mindless endless runs that's best in between games if you ask me. Just too little variety. Holopoint is better for this kind of gameplay. Teleporting and free locomotion feels slow. Gauntlet VR (Ready Player One) is almost if not just as good and it's free.

It's actually 4.5 stars because I'm having so much fun with this game. I've been saying "OK. just ONE more go" for the past 2.5 hours. Haven't done that since SuperHot VR. The machanics of using your bow is tremendously done. Feels very natural, and I feel that if I miss, it's my lousy aim, not the game mechanics. The sound design is also very cool, the "THUNK" of a headshot is very satisfying, and the music gives the game a great atmosphere. I also really don't mind the shard-throwing teleporting. I rarely use the arrow teleport, pretty much only to shoot  into towers to go shopping. So, why only 4.5 stars ? I think there's still work to be done. I came across a few, admittedly, very minor irks. For instance, I was in battle with a monk and he decided to teleport closer... well, he teleported ON/IN me. I could see his tunic coming from my body. He couldn't kill me, I couldn't kill him. It was madness. I also had a situation where, I sharded into an area, realised the folly of my ways as it was VERY crowded, sharded my way back out the way I came and heard something behind me. I turned and it was an axe-wielding knight. Who just looked at me. He didn't do anything till I shot him first. These minor things aside, I'm really having a great time with this game. It's ohhh, SO close to being 5 Stars, hopefully when it comes out of early-access, it will be. It has the potential to be a really, really good game.

A great experience that is way too repetitive because when it comes down to it, there is only one level in the game.
Level 2,3,4,5,6 look the same as the first (procedurally generated) so it gets old pretty quick.
Still the game manages to draw me in. With more story and variation this would easily be a 5 star game. 20 bucks for one level is way too steep.

Game is great, I havent encountered any bugs yet, and it plays super smooth.  Dont let the early access tag scare you, this is a fully playable game that feels finished, but hopefully will get even better.  I love the teleport system, its different thn other games and that makes it more enjoyable and creates super intense moments where I am cornered and have to choose between shooting my bow at an enemy or teleporting away.  
It has no story, and its just one repeated long brawl, but as long as you know that going in you should have a great time.

This game is pretty much perfect for anyone who loves top quality archery combined with a roque like beautiful map and an awesome soundtrack. 

I dont get why people complain about things like gold reseting when you die (Its a roque like thats the thing roque like games do) or enemies like "ghosts" are unkillable when they clearly just haven't played enough to understand how to defeat them (arrow to the chest).

UPDATE: The bow has pretty much completely been fixed and feels really smooth now. I also have invested a lot more hours to this game. I am starting to think more and more than this game needs to keep your progress when you leave at any point. Having to finish the entire purgatory takes at least 25 minutes. If you add all the different pits (extra stages) and you take your time with killing every enemy it all adds up to about 50 minutes just to be able to quit without losing your progress. This is I think a bit too much. Other than that still an amazing game and it keeps getting better!

A little one dimensional in that it's fairly limited as a concept but that said the gameplay really draws you in. Challenging and very easy to find yourself hooked. Locomotion does give you an advantage but this can be combined with teleportation so there's the option to limit it's use if you have a low comfort threshold. 

Looks beautiful with the settings turned up. Well worth buying just to duck and dive some arrows and flail aimlessly at giant violent knights!
Played this Games at a friends house. It was the deciding factor in me getting an Occulus. I can't wait to see the end product.

The game is good but needs to be fun for everyone, not just the super skilled and dedicated.  Take a look at Skyrim.  Immensely popular.  You can save anytime, anywhere, for any reason.  Still each battle is exciting and immersive, without the player having to be punished for being a little less than proficient.  You're doing so much right.  Relax and open this game up a bit with the ability to save.

This game is all experience, you go through dungeons.. in the sky.. kill bad guys with your bows and arrows and die, and do it again, excepot he dungeon is different everytime, but has similiar elements.

Great experience, but no storyline. I highly recommend it.
The game is unique, but bow has an issue, collision ? or something like that and change the direction alone ..

This is a rogue like archery game with a gothic / purgatory / religious / dungeon setting. The graphics are very atmospheric and realistic for a fantasy game. It's beautiful to look at. 

The important things are right here. The archery is very satisfying and rewards skill. Making that long range headshot is very nice and the "thunk" it makes when it connects is great positive feedback. The enemies aren't too static to make it too easy, and react nicely to being hit, making you feel like you are really doing something. Not only that there are some interesting power-up arrows that you can unlock and collect as you go through the game. Some add more firepower, others can be used a bit tactically acting as mines and traps.

Movement is a joy. I find using the thrown teleport crystal much faster than the 
teleport arrow, and I recommend using this to get about, unless you fancy those roof top shenannigans I mentioned earlier. I understand there are some free-movement options, but I haven't felt I wanted to use them yet.

You can play the game as a sneaky stealth ninja, or as a full on Legolas teleporting from roof to roof and then close in for that close range face shot. 
Killing multiple enemies in seconds is also possible particularly when zombies are closing in.

Some people have complained that there are limited enemy types, but as you play more the enemies get progressively harder. You'll start to dread seeing that gold clad archer that peppers you with multiple arrows and decimates your health, or that black clad "the mountain" soldier who just refuses to go down. Plus maybe they haven't found the portal yet? There are definately new tougher enemies in there, if you are brave enough!

Some of the enemies are genuinely scary. One in particular has me reaching for the toilet paper every single time he jumps me! I don't know what it is about it, but it's like "leave me alone!" every time. 
Overall: Highly recommend!

review_title: Dangit free weekend! Got me again
one_reviews_text:
I wasn't going to buy this... but having a chance to play it first, I immediately fell in love. This game is awesome! I think based on aesthetic preference and a strong feeling of nostalgia-- being reminded of Diablo 2 (but getting to be inside it, hell yes!)-- this is my favorite between Robo Recall and Sairento VR, which I consider to each be a gamechanging experiences and amazing in their own right

review_title: It Does One Thing and It Does it Well
one_reviews_text: Sure you have your Grand Theft Autos that try to be a shooting, driving, dancing, flying, exploring story-driven game (and it's all well and good if the game does most of what it tries well) but I'm a big fan of the game that focuses on one thing and one thing alone.  In Death is an archery game, and it's a very good one.  Dodging, blocking, shooting: pretty much everything you'd expect from a game based on archery combat and for a good price to boot.  It can be a bit spooky at times, and I suppose it can be classified as horror, but it's by no means gory or gratuitous.  In fact, the occasional jump scare really adds to the experience, and it's one of the few games I don't mind dying in.  The learning curve is present, but when I die in the game I don't feel cheated, and I'm quite anxious to get back in and try again.  Not a lot of games do that for me.  My only complaint is the scenery can get pretty repetitive pretty quickly.  It would be nice if there were different locations than “labyrinthine gothic cathedral,” though one thing is worth noting: it IS still in early access.  There’s probably more to come.  And for an early access game it is surprisingly well constructed already.  It's a challenging game but a rewarding one I strongly recommend.

review_title: One of my favorite VR games, has flaws
one_reviews_text: What this game is about is already in the product description, so I don't need to say anything here. For 20$ this game is a must have. This is one of the few VR games I've actually purchased (I've been playing a lot of the free games that came with the Oculus, along with things like Superhot VR and Payday 2.) I have only played for 2 hours and I feel like I've barely scratched the surface. This game is physically demanding but is really enjoyable. My only gripe is the movement mechanics. You can either use the bow and shoot to the spot you want to teleport, or hold the grip button and throw a shard that teleports you to where you want to move. There is a smooth locomotion option but it is extremely slow. like to the point where it's main purpose is probably to just move around corners. I would love for that to be made faster, but at the same time I can see how it would hinder the game. When you get shot towards or an enemy tries to melee you, you're supposed to either dodge or hold the trigger on your non dominant hand (hand you hold the bow in) to bring up a shield and block it. Having smooth locomotion be faster would mean you could just move the joystick and be out of the way. Like moving at times especially when you're moving from one area to the next can be somewhat demanding, more so than usually just shooting down a line of enemies. So something about that just feels off. One annoying bug is that when an enemy archer nocks his arrow, and you try to teleport behind him, he will instantly shoot you, even if he wasn't even turned around himself. The arrow just comes out of his back and pierces you in the face, it's really annoying when even one health bar is so crucial.

The teleport system works very well, and adding the ability to move with the joystick (via experimental features) is helpful too. By the time I got to the actual game I walked around with the "experimental moving" option for about 10 seconds before I opted to use the cleverly crafted teleport system.  I've only played this game for about 30 minutes but this is the first time I've EVER played a game in VR where the controls actually felt intuitive enough to react to real time events without much thought and actually come out on top in highly difficult situations.  Plus they include an option to change from seated to standing which is a MUST I believe in any VR title.

And using a procedurally generated rogue like atmosphere  is perfect for VR since I end up replaying a lot of my favorite titles anyway because VR games are so short and great VR games are few and far between. Everyone was raving about this, so I bought it, fired it up, and immediately couldn't figure out how to get around or select arrows or defeat a single enemy even with the help they gave. And then...something happened. It all started to click. Next thing I knew, I was leaping on rooftops and across chasms, down hallways, picking off enemies all over the place. Even made it to the boss. I usually don't repeat play VR games that frequently, but this one flows so well when you figure it out, and there's nothing more satisfying than picking off some chump via arrow-to-the-face from 100 yards away in another building. In just two plays it went from "what the hell is this" to "how did I live without this?" If I had to come up with a couple minor quibbles, it would be the lack of furnishings in the rooms (no chairs, tables, nothing. Who lives in this castle?), and there's usually no reward for exploration; you fight your way to a dead end that's just that - a dead end. Still a great, fun, rewarding game, though.

review_title: Most enjoyable VR roguelike so far
one_reviews_text:
And it helps that archery is intrinsically so much better-suited to motion controls than anything melee. A great design choice from the start to be archery-only, right down to the teleportation method, and aided by the Christian-mythological "Purgatory" setting and atmosphere suited to a roguelike, evoking very 12th-century themes of melancholy bow-wielding angels against the somber darkness.

Especially helpful is the variety of enemy behaviors, compared to similar experiences. While the AI is by no means sophisticated, the design here does not allow the player to become complacent. Around the next corner could just as well be a hooded archer that will teleport around as if mocking the player themself, a leaping zombie-ghoul thing that will have you anxiously flinching whenever it draws too close, or a helmeted axe-wielding knight that can simply chop through any of your defenses.

The early access state is most apparent in how objects are generated into the procedural levels, currently often misaligned with the walls they're supposed to be attached to. But thankfully, these are all decorative objects suffering such problems and not anything mechanically significant.

One criticism I would have is of the controls when it comes to interacting with menus, using the trigger to select menu items. This is a problem across VR generally, that some developers use the trigger and others the A button. As usual, my suggestion would be to just use both. Since the A button doesn't do anything else in menus already, why not respond the same way to both.

Theres not much to say that hasnt already been said by others but this game has excellent core mechanics. 
The difficulty curve is perfect and when you get into the rhythm with the bow it is extremely satisfying.
It can be creepy at times in a good way, I really wasnt expecting to get as spooked as I have. I play with the ceiling fan on me and it helps to trick me into believing im in a drafty castle. Every single play I get chills at least once - great job!

A couple of thoughts for the devs (understanding that this is in early access, they're propbably already onto it but i'll mention anyway just in case)

- the locomotion system although functional is a little limiting, It would be great to have a roborecall-esque ability to rotate yourself as you teleport allowing you to face your target more quickly or to look around corners.

- an ability to somehow know where i've already been or where I haven't been, as the corridors can look the same after a while and sometimes i'm not sure if i'm going forward or back

review_title: Free movement needs work but still great
one_reviews_text:
First up: You really can't play this without using the teleportation.  I used a mix of free movement and teleport for one very simple reason: You can go anywhere.  Take to the rooftops to bypass a particularly difficult hallway or just to get a better vantage from which to rain destruction.  Some enemies can also teleport and love to flank you.  The environment is intricately decorated, from the stained glass windows to the statues and bas reliefs there's clearly been a great deal of work go into the detail.  There's a free movement option, though it would benefit from smooth turning and possibly a sprint function - it feels incredibly slow.  The rest of the controls work quite well - aiming and firing an arrow feels as natural as it can without having an actual string to pull.  Blocking incoming fire works well, as does ducking and dodging.  I did have the occasional niggle when trying to throw a teleport shard - the game thought I was trying to fire a teleport arrow instead, so instead of teleporting sideways into cover I teleported forwards into the thick of the enemies.  This is definitely one that's going to be on the Must Have list though.

Update (Feb 21 2018) Movement has been improved massively.  Smooth turning is in as an option and things feel a little faster.  Additionally, throwing a teleport shard can optionally be on the grip instead of the face buttons, making it much easier to throw it when you want.  Upgrading to 5 stars for the awesome attention to the community by the dev team.

I went into this game not expecting much and was absolutely blown away by it. This is a rogue-like game in which you traverse a procedurally generated dungeon and fight everything with a bow. There's no other game like this on the Rift right now, and it's absolutely fantastic.

The best thing about this game has to be the bow mechanics. The bow feels absolutely fantastic and many of the special arrows feel genuinely powerful. But the best feeling of this game is when you nail that long distance shot, or blast someone right in the head. It's also very tense, and sometimes even a little scary. I've screamed a few times as I've turned at the last minute to see a swordsman swinging right at me, to hurriedly smack him away with my shield. This game can really have incredibly intense moments of action and this is when it's at it's best. The new enemies and items that unlock as you unlock achievements keep the game fresh and constantly developing. Whilst sadly most enemies are based around 3 basic variants, the changing dungeon layout, enemy compositions and random arrow types you'll get will keep you changing approach constantly. One run may be all about the spam as you ricochet arrows around huge rooms. Others you may lay traps on the ground and use careful movement to lure the enemy into your bombs.

The bad comes mostly from the procedural nature of the game. Enemy bowmen are your most dangerous threat by a long way. Their shots are always deadly accurate, and if the game spawns a bunch of them you'll probably die as you constantly need to move to avoid their arrows. Particularly in the boss fight, this is infuriating and can really ruin your game.  When you have a good combination of enemies to keep you on your toes, this game is fantastic. Similarly, you can be screwed over by bad loot drops and health is almost impossible to come by. In spite of it's flaws however, this is a standout unique game and tons of fun. I highly recommend it.

As you play the game you unlock achievements, which give you new types of arrows, upgrade your damage/hp, and add new, tougher varations of the enemies to the map. This means the progression that most games go through, where you get better weapons but harder enemies in later levels, is there throughout in later runs. So, you can jump right into the meat of the game straight away every time you play.
